page.title: 05INDUSTRY AT EASTFIELD
page.content: To the south of the residential housing area of Eastfield is an area of light industrial development. This area has grown since the 1960's and is still being extended. At present it contains a variety of developments. These include three small storage / factory areas linked to the supply of electrical components. One of these, Faraday House, is a small factory linked to Dale Electric. Dale sell electrical generators throughout the world. A large steel storage area makes up part of the estate. Other developments include a large commercial vehicle testing station, a large storage / service area for lorries and a cash and carry. Much of the activity here is linked to McCain's frozen food factory. However the major development on the site is Plaxton's coach building firm.
